comments.body: It makes sense, and I assume it wouldn't be hard to program. Making Minecart rails more relevant seems like a good idea to me, though making gravel the optimal material may make some builders feel a bit constrained. +1 at any rate though, as this would be a net positive change
It would give gravel a use other than making concrete and flint which is nice.
Faster minecarts and another use for gravel? You got my vote.
Maybe my favorite idea I've seen on this site

I really like this idea. I think it would be great. It improves a game mechanic, makes use of another existing/under-used materials, and has a real-world basis.

I disagree the comment (February 27, 2020 19:57). I don't think that it would be that constraining. If people can make ice boat transport systems, than they could do this. Creative might be annoying since gravel is a gravity block. However, it still adds to realism and another block under the gravel block, wouldn't hurt too much
Beautiful Idea.  Ballast just hope the devs say the same.  :)

This would be a fantastic addition to the game. You could add ballast to the game by combining 4-9 gravel in a crafting grid. Minecarts need an update desperately to make them competitive with ice-boat highways and elytra's. This would be an outstanding way to make minecarts useful without breaking any redstone contraptions.
it literally has no downsides. it doesnt affect redstone and it makes minecarts good for transportation. do it mojang. this better happen before the end update.
We urgently need faster minecarts. Honestly I dont care how its done, Ill rebuild my entire city's underground train network happily if it means theyre faster

That is massively overpowered.  Especially since you can get emeralds from villagers for junk like vegetables and rotten flesh.  I have over a stack of emerald blocks in my world, and that's a fraction of what I could have if I wanted it.  When I beat the wither, I'll probably use emeralds to make my top tier beacon.  If you don't think villagers are the best source of emeralds, you haven't decided to take them seriously as a feature.
Take it from my experience in my Zelda Sword Skills/Mine Blade & Battlegear/Emerald and Obsidian Tools and Armour-centric modpack, even regular emerald armor would be OP AF.
Way way way too op.  Emeralds don‚Äôt really have a use in real life other than looking fancy and being valuable.
If its so op, then make villagers not trade emralds
This is absurdly OP. I just want normal, basic, simple emerald armour and tools that are about as good as diamond stuff, give or take.
Awesome!  The only thing is, if there‚Äôs emerald there should be a  obsidian, cobblestone, and Kevlar  which could be created in one way or another.
Overpowered, minecraft already confirmed that its never coming
Way to over powered...
yes, ive been wanting all of this for a year
good idea but I think there a little to overpowered
Please never let this happen Its bad enough diamond is the best tool finally being repalaced netherite.
This is just too OP.
I think emerald pickaxes should be able to break bedrock, but it‚Äôs very slow.
Um... Tools Out Of CURRENCY ?
If you think getting emerald is hard than I have one word: RAID!!! I literally get like 80 emerald per raid and I don‚Äôt even have a raid farm.
Maybe Green hearts instead of golden ones. I would prefer golden hearts for enchanted golden armour/tools with a new enchantment "Double Life" or else...

make them worse than gold attack wise but the durablity of stone equipment

 

 

also probally not making emeralds easer they are way to easy already
YES EMERALDS PLSSSS EMERALDS
I was just about to post this idea!
I was thinking the exact same thing! Maybe craft them from emerald BLOCKS otherwise they would be way too good.

ADD EMERALD TOOLS XD

And make them powerful
This is a VERY good idea
Well, the post is great, I like that. But you will need to suggest the durability of tools (e.g diamond tools is 1561). I suggest durability is 1750
Too op.  If you made emerald armor reduce villager costs, then this would be fine (permitted you reduce the tools stats down to gold.
I think emeralds should stay as currency used for trading with villagers. In addition, gold should stay as currency for trading with piglins and used for niche crafting.

I mean it is a great idea but I think the damage is just a too powerful and the pickaxe is literally in creative mode so it makes it a bit not fun anymore if your that powerful but maybe the emerald could be a a bit hard to get (no offence)

As a pie-lover, I greatly appreciate this idea, but I think different pies should offer different advantages. For example, apples are somewhat more common, so maybe they don‚Äôt fill as much hunger, but you would be able to make more of these pies. As for chocolate, depending on where you spawn, it can be harder to get cocoa beans to make this item, so maybe it fills more hunger or has better saturation. It could also be both a little useful and funny if eating the chocolate pie gave you a ‚Äúsugar rush‚Äù and increased your speed slightly for a tiny bit. The concept of ‚Äúmore variations on existing recipes‚Äù could be expanded with cakes as well, with chocolate cake and, as was mentioned in a different comment, carrot cake.
Now with 1.14 with sweet berries, what about sweet berry pie?
Also Sweet Berry Pie with Sweet Berries introduced in 1.14.
Yes! Apple pie, carrot pue, potato pie, meat pie, chocolate pie, sweet Berrie pie you name it! Wheat sugar and said food item.
Love the idea! I‚Äôm a HUUGGEE advocate for updating Minecraft‚Äôs food/cooking system. So love that someone else is trying for an update to the food/cooking system as well! Keep up the good work!

I think this is an obvious one... We should already have new pies... And I'd like to add that we should be able to place the pies like we can place a cake... In fact, it would be great if we could place all of the food ;)  Imagine having a huge table full of all of your favorite foods!  :D

386251107692 yeah I'm weird (I think it's just me anyway) so for some reason I really enjoy making different food and recipes and things in video games even if I have to go way out of my way to do it and it doesn't really make that big a difference, lol. I do the same thing with fashion.
What about berry pie? Now that berries are in minecraft I think that they could also maybe be an option for new pies!! :))
Please add apple pie and sweet berry pie.
We we also need sweet berry pie :)

To expand on this idea and the desire to give all things purpose in minecraft, pies and cakes should work similarly to the stew mechanic, switch the main filling for pies and add an ingredient with cakes, perhaps even with cookies, but im reaching with that one üòÜ.

With the addition of these various pie types I think it would be a lovely way to interact with villagers. By giving different types of dishes to different types of villagers, either by profession or by biome type. You could get something similar to the hero effect like a Hospitable effect and instead invoking rarer trades, or getting them to work faster.

This new system could be a limited time effect after the gift or based on a happiness/friendship meter that either is refillable and diminishes over time or one that permanently levels up/unlocks the desired effect on the villager.

chicken and mushroom?

Beef?
they should be placeable btw.
We should have apple, sweet berry pie, chicken pie, and beef pie! similar recipe as the pumpkin pie but replace the pumpkin with the apple, sweet berry, chicken and steak.
We need chocolate pie, apple pie, golden apple pie, berry pie, glow berry pie, shepherds pie, and potato pie. Maybe you could add a pizza too :)
Better yet, put a tap on a tree (you could use a tripwire hook) and after a while, the tap should be able to be clicked to get the syrup, (it has a long cool down)

I think this is a good idea, and since cows will give infinite milk I don't see how having infinite maple syrup would ruin anything, especially when you need a bucket to store it and they don't stack.
Why not instead of a bucket, it's a glass bottle? Maple trees can only give you so much tree sap!
buckets have too many things why not make it glass bottles?

I would change it into the following: you can click only once per maple tree log because after being clicked once with a bucket, it turns into dried maple log.

The normal maple planks have the same brightness level as the oak planks but with a lore copperish color, wile the dried maple planks have the same brightness level as the birch planks but are rather a very bright beige than a yellowish tone.

Oh, and it'd have red leaves.

The pankakes would bea good idea, but I'd also add the option of dumping a bucket of maple syrup on the snow and collect it with sticks, for 16 maple syrup on sticks per bucket.
You should be able to drink maple syrup and it should give speed II (like when you are sugar high)

I think it should come with a spike. Then you have to boil the sap to make syrup. Just like on real life. Hang the bucket on the spile to fill up with sap, then when you boil it, put it into glass bottles.
Wow I was never notified that I had comments on this. These are also good ideas, I wasn‚Äôt even thinking about a glass bottle

My dad is an award winning Maple Syrup Producer.

Why not have the mechanics be realistic???

Hang a bucket or bottle, after some delay say 1 day you get a full bucket or bottle.

(By 1 day I mean change from day to night to day. No need to time a full "day".)

For a forest giant you might be able to hang 2 or even 3 buckets.

Get a number of full buckets (40 would be too many for a game, but 4-6 might work), put into a furnace and get syrup.

Use Syrup with Bread to get a new food: French Toast!
There leafs should be orange and the planks have a little bit of maple syrup on it maby. You should also be able to have a pool of maple syrup.

When you use a new item a tap, on the maple tree, you could put a bottle in an empty bottle slot. This would give you sap (another food source). When combined with sugar you would get syrup giving basically acting like honey bottles (except for the honey blocks). You could use 4 bottles of sap to make sugar cubes. This could also implement a new job the Sweetsmith. A villager job that would sell sap, honey, and sweet berries. You could use 2 sugar cubes and 4 wood planks to make the sweet station.
Omg me and my friend was talking about this super snart hope they see

I think that tapping a maple tree with a bucket can give you sap, and then in a furnace you can get syrup. If you drink the syrup you can get sugar rush which is swiftness 1 for a minute then slowness 1 for 1 minute

Although I 85% agree with this, I believe that there should be a different system of getting syrup. I believe that one should need to build a tap which (through RNG) fills up in between one and four minutes. After it is collected it can be boiled from sap (which does nothing if drunk) in a furnace to syrup. (Much as Claysoldier said)
I think maybe there could also be a slightly different way to make waffles too, so the maple syrup can go on those as well.
They should have their own biome and orange leaves.

i think you should be able craft something thin a tripwire hook bottle and 2 iron place it on the maple tree and then  the bottle will turn brownish when its ready then right click on it use the sryup on the bread and then wright click to put back the bottle

When planted as saplings, maple tree leaves could appear green. When they grow to full size, the tree will randomly decide if its foliage will be burgundy, red, orange, or yellow. Perhaps there could be a new biome for maple forests. That way there could be autumn foliage in Minecraft.

I also love the idea of hanging a bucket on a tree with an iron tap to get maple sap (I like the one bucket per day idea), then cooking the sap down in a furnace into bottles of maple syrup. That would be excellent for new recipes to make candies or breakfast foods.
I don't know about the pancakes but maple trees good idea
I don't know about the use, but having maple tree in the game would be pretty. They should come with autumn colored leaves and make up the new forest called temperate forest

i had a similar idea, where with 1 stick, 5 string and 3 iron, in the shape of a blast furnace. place the... well i don't know the official name for it. but any way, place "it" on a maple tree an eventually, syrup appears. bottle it up and you get a newly skinned bottle with something resembling the label. it acts as honey, drink it and poison goes away and it turns to a normal bottle again. you can make a block out of them. honey is yellow while syrup is brown. it sticks like slime, and, you can swim in it. its not like water, though, because it doesn't spread. crafted with 2 wheat, 1 milk, 1 sweetberries(?) and the syrup, makes a pancake, that, when eaten, gives a load of hunger! on youtube, the action lab did a test, and sure enough, the bath toys swam at the same speed. check it out sometime!
It would also be great if the maple tree also gave it a new type of wood.

It would also be cool if the trees had red leaves since all the leaves we have now are green. Also it would be cool to be able to craft a syrup block that would work a lot like scaffolding where you could sink down and stay suspended within it. Another cool addition would be to make the flapjacks placeable like a cake, and make the player bounce when they jump on them just like they would with a bed
Yay!  what about bacon, eggs and pancakes with maple syrup?
I want red leaves for decoration and orange and yellow :3

I know everyone's excited about this for the Maple Syrup but I'm happy because maple Tree planks could provide the missing gap between Spruce and Dark Oak! I've always wanted a sorta burnt umber maple color for doors and floors

I love this idea, but you didn't go too in depth on the wood it will give, so I did it for you.

The logs are a simple brown

The planks look like oak, but are slightly more red, and has a little bit of a shine unlike any other wood type.

The leaves are a red-orange color

The tree itself starts with a straight trunk, and then the leaves generate like a thicker acacia tree

 

I also want to add that it shouldn't be a bucket to collect syrup, but rather a bottle. Also, you can't collect the syrup from maple wood you placed. It has to be straight from the tree
The maple trees should be in their own biome, the maple forest. It has red-orange colored plants, and bees spawn everywhere.
It would be too easy to get the syrup and pancakes aren`t made of bread. They should have a diferent recipe but the pancakes are a good idea.

I would love this! Maple trees with orange or red leaves to act as a more autumnal looking tree would be amazing, especially now that we have cherry blossoms which are more of a spring blooming tree. Maybe wheat instead of bread to make pancakes, but it would be quite nice to have syrup as an item/ingredient along with just more visual leaf variety.
Maple Trees should have red, yellow and orange leaves, the wood colour should be a golden colour like the syrup and the wood can be crafted into many things tbh
Maybe this could be expanded more with a whole syrup making process and used like honey but with something that is added to it to make it stand out more
Why not instead of a bucket, it's a glass bottle?and you can crafting it into sugar
There should be orange sheep in the maple tree forest
And we could have colourful autumn leaves, too!
Yes, defo aquarium glass and a good verity of fish.

There is basically one way that I can imagine aquarium glass actually working.  Basically, the thin pane would be up against the edge of the block.  Either it is waterlogged and prevents water from flowing out the side where the pane is (like how waterlogged stairs don't flow through the "solid" faces of the stair block) or you place it so that the pane is against the water but is not waterlogged, but is flush against the block that does contain water.
These blocks could also be used for making better terrariums
Yeah I'd love this. I love making aquariums since 1.13 but it's such a bummer you can hardly see the fish behind the glass :(

This probably should have already been added into 1.13. I would prefer that regular glass would allow you to see through water already. But if this is the price of aquariums, I guess it'll have to do.
I would like a glass pane that emits light! Remove the streaks! Clean lines!
It would be a good decoration!
THis would be amazing, but we could also add more types of glass to.

The clunkiness of full glass blocks is annoying but manageable IMO. I‚Äôd really like to see some sort of clarified glass option, just to remove the streaks. Or even if aquarium panes functioned like full blocks so the water wouldn‚Äôt run on the back side causing fish to get stuck; that would be nice too. There are some really nice fish models out there now and it‚Äôs a shame you can‚Äôt showcase them any better.
Maybe changing the panes to be at the edge of the block instead of the middle when in contact with water could remove the problems with glass-pane aquariums.
i think a better way is to make a glass that acts like a cauldron and can be combined like stairs to make what size your aquarium is

My problem with the glass blocks is that the water isn‚Äôt clear to see the fish or sea life. I decided to build a Minecraft Aquarium but the water is too cloudy. It‚Äôs like looking into stained glass. If you jump into water, it‚Äôs cloudy at first but then it clears up. We need a type of marine glass that makes water clear
Yes, like the ability to waterlog one side of the glass panes.
No!  Birds could carry hardly anything!
HAHAHHAHHAHHAHA that‚Äôs the best idea I‚Äôve ever heard for a nonsensical modpack!
though maybe a sort of bird-mail system would be really cool. Perhaps you could send birds to to other players with one item slot - not really sure if that would be useful at all, though.
I could add it to bluey
Like those messenger birds
birds should have 1 item slot. and you should only be able to tell it a general direction. it should come back unless killed.
I have concerns.
Somehow, this might actually be a good idea, we already have slow falling and leaping, so why not slipping, but instead of bananas, I feel it could be blue ice, as it is rare
If anyone didn‚Äôt know,I chose adding bananas over using ice(as Rufus suggested)because I wanted a way to get the effect without silk touch(as I said)
You could also accidentally fall off ladders and vines.
What if you could get the effect from brewing with a fish? Fish are slippery, and it wouldn‚Äôt be too overpowered because the effect isn‚Äôt neccessarily good.
Good.
Hhhh

Me gusta pero tambi√©n tengo otra sugerencia y es que 2 personas puedan montar un mismo caballo y que no cualquier caballo lo pueda hacer solo los que tengan bastante velocidad y vida y que se vea en la parte de los corazones de los caballos en forma de rayitos (por ejemplo) y as√≠ no los tengas que dom√©sticar a fuerzas, lo que tambi√©n permite la acci√≥n de que los caballos te sigan cuando los dom√©sticas y dejen de aserlo con una cuerda o un Silvido haciendo doble click y en el caso de dispositivos m√≥viles un segundo bot√≥n alado del montar talvez suene muy "exagerado" loco eso de que silves pero con una cuerda tambi√©n est√° bien. :)

Here is a translation

Have you ever thought about horses pulling carts? They could slow down while pulling the cart, but you could carry two or three double chests inside, allowing you to trade between villages for lots of materials or go on long campaigns. It could have (as I said) two or three double chests, one bed, one crafting table, and one furnace. Vote if you want horse-drawn carts in Minecraft
Yes. It should only bounce off blocks.
Yes! You could be able to have more air supply
Turtle shell helmet.  (My mind suddenly blanked on what it is called üò¨)
same
Yes, improved furnace minecarts to build railroads would be wonderful
Have minecarts travel faster than elytras making places you travel to often better with a minecart, but when exploring an elytra is better because you won't need to set it up

I think that rails have so much more potential in Minecraft.

Powered rails are usually too expensive in the early game to make much use of, and the furnace minecart is too unreliable to use. This results in seldom use of rails.

I think powered rails are fine how they are now. However the furnace minecart needs some serious TLC. It is used so infrequently that it doesn't even exist in the Bedrock Edition. For one it is too slow a means of transport and as it exists now, the furnace minecart travels in the direction opposite which the player places the fuel in. This means if I am sitting in a minecart and turn around to fuel a furnace minecart, it takes off in the other direction!

For the speed issue, it could be made so different fuels affect the speed of the minecart and I have a couple ideas for the other problem. One could be to add a UI to the furnace minecart where the fuel is placed inside and there is a button to swap directions, or instead of a UI a player would click on it with an open hand to swap directions with some visual indicator on the entity.

Just these fixes alone I think would make rails a lot more viable early game. But I think that there is so much more that could flesh out rails too. Considering it is a game where mining is central, minecarts should play a bigger role. Just a couple other ideas would be the ability to couple minecarts together and to add a new rail type which seamlessly connects 3-4 rails and intuitively switches directions with redstone.

Yes! Powered rails are great for farms, but for long distance travel they are very expensive. If you don't have an elytra, long distance travel can be very time consuming. Furnace minecarts traveling a little slower than the elytra, perhaps the 2nd or third fastest means of travel in the game, would be a game changer, especially if you could hook minecarts together with a chain.
I had the same Idea
Is that because you are subscribed to the man named Systemzee
What is a copper block?
I like this idea as it would start a building revolution. Perhaps you can craft copper with coal and sticks and create a green torch.

Only 1 copper ingot (replacing the coal) should be required to make a copper campfire, so you don't use so much copper. And if you wanted to create Green fire torches or Green Lanterns, you would craft it with copper nuggets (We Need Copper Nuggets).

You should rename your post title to "Green Fire With Copper," so it gets more votes. People might not know what you mean by simply "copper fire."

I also enjoyed the idea of green flames as well as them not effect spawning which with the 1.18 looking to lower it to zero I think this would be a clever way to keep spawn places but still be able to see without a potion.
Nonsense. Copper SALTs are needed to color the flame, but not pure copper.
I think Crafting Tables should have a 3x3 grid on both the input and the output. That way, when multiple items come out they can have multiple spots
I like how you think!
This is on youtube
that would be to powerful you could put a low durability netherite sword and recraft it
Paul the dragon correct but it could be made so that it gives you less depending on the duribility
that should be called a de-crafting table.
that is true though

This is a great idea. It could be used to disassemble certain items like redstone repeaters or lecterns into their constituent parts, but it would probably be advantageous to not allow certain one way items, like stairs or concrete powder. It could have a darker design and the UI could have a one square space on the left and a 3x3 grid on the right.
Very good idea! :)
Throwing spears to make the dragon fight more interesting
No sense, the piglins has fear of blue fire.
Not much else to add here. I'm not sure why they didn't do this in the first place.
As mentioned piglins fear blue fire and actually avoid any kind (fire, torches, campfires and lanterns) if possible. Adding soul lanterns to bastions would cause them to flee from their own buildings
Piglins are scared of soul fire so it would kinda be counter intuitive
Considering how Piglins LIVE in bastions, I don't think keeping them in a perpetual state of terror is ideal. :P

No sense, remember that piglin They are scared of the soul fire and soul lantern, it makes more sense that they are those because the coal in the nether is obtained from the wither skeletons that are the enemies of the piglin
Nah, too scary for the residents
Piglins are afraid of anything soul fire, that would not make any sense.
This makes no absolute sense since piglins are scared of soul fire, soul torches, soul lanterns, and soul campfires. They are scared of everything that has to do with soul fire.
Too scary for the residents, piglins are scared of everything soul.

It's called an ender pearl and fast reflexes. The end is supposed to be scary and the void is supposed to be near guaranteed death if you happen to end up in there. This would remove the edge of exploring the end and turn one of the dimension's biggest threats into a minor inconvenience.

This is a cool concept! maybe you could parallel the temporary regen effects a regular totem gives you by instead giving a temporary flying affect? Like, the totem will let you fly as if you had an eleytra with rockets for a short duration? Either way, this seems really interesting!

In survival mode, it is practically impossible to fall into the void outside of the end. This most likely wouldn't even be useful in the end because the ender dragon encounter happens in the middle of the island. The outer end islands could be an applicable use for this, however, as it is easy to fall into the void when traveling between islands. But, as Nathan said, the void is supposed to be foreboding and dangerous. This would completely negate the purpose of the void.

I do agree with Nathan and Alex, but i do find the idea insteresting.  Maybe a "void totem", instead of gold, the totem is silver with purple eyes.  Crafted with one totem of undying surrounded by four ender pearls
What is a "tontem"?
It would be a very useful item especially since some fights with the ender dragon or skulkers can bring you quite close to falling off.
I realy like the antidote idea
It could also maybe make Blue Nether Brick
Um... milk?
Yeah, we already have milk. I see why you might not want to erase your night vision etc., but I don't think we need antidotes.

Milk will cure everything.
And honey will only cure poison.
The potential for antidote lies in the treatment of individual effects.
It can be used on various adventure maps, but will also have a significant share in PvP.
Archers with anti-effect arrows can save allies from negative ministers, or weaken enemies who have drunk a potion of strength.
Try to combine the turtle master's potion and the anti-slowdown potion.
Create thrown anti-potions for battle with the witch.
The potential is huge and gives a lot of possibilities, not to mention the new, warped warts, and new blocks with their use.

Definitely approve of this idea, and unlike milk it wouldn't cure all effects at once, which makes it still logical to use it over a regular potion when you want to remove a specific effect only. It also feels like something missing with how warped wart is not actually a thing yet.

Maybe we can use nylium instead of soul sand to grow them. All you would need to do is use a hoe on a crimson/nylium block and it can become nether farmland. We could even use lava to make them grow faster.

Maybe they can grow on soul soil instead of soul sand? Also maybe there's a timer of immunity, like say a few to 30 seconds so if the status effect gets reapplied, it won't work while the immunity is on.
Yeah, that's cooler than just inverted potions.

Przepraszam, je≈õli to ju≈º tu jest, poniewa≈º u≈ºywam google translate i nie wiem, co powiedzia≈Çy inne odpowiedzi, ale nie widzƒô sensu dodawania antidotum do mikstury, je≈õli mleko istnieje jako mleko, usuwa wszystkie efekty mikstury i jest bardzo tanie w wykonaniu. Ale mo≈ºe byƒá u≈ºyty do stworzenia przeciwie≈Ñstwa niekt√≥rych mikstur, takich jak ≈õwiecenie zamiast noktowizora lub ciƒô≈ºko≈õƒá zamiast przyspieszenia skoku lub lewitacja przed powolnym spadaniem. Ale to tylko sugestia. Mimo wszystko podoba mi siƒô ten pomys≈Ç.
I completely support this. It would be awesome to be able to dye something other than leather.
Maybe not specifically the ingot being dye-able but at least the armor?
instead of the ingot being dyable just the armor and tools would also work
This would be cool, for the armor if you can be able to dye it like leather armor.
Perhaps a new variant is also in order: normal basalt, just the top texture. Found on the floors of the pillars?
What about bricks or pillars / chiselled variants as well?

I would think that smooth basalt would look a little bit like asphalt, and that's a good thing. Imagine roads with smooth basalt! It seems more vanilla-minecrafty to have smooth basalt instead of asphalt.
Exactly! And blocks that have same texture at all sides
There's already a suggestion about minecart chains that attach minecarts to each other.
I always wanted to do something like that. :D good idea.
Maybe you could also do this with leads?

"There's already a suggestion about minecart chains that attach minecarts to each other."

I realize this, and I had actually written a lot more for this proposal, including the chains idea, but I hit the character limit.

I think my proposal is a lot more consistent with the current minecraft universe, as sticky things already exist. It reduces the number of extra items that would need to be implemented and it makes it overall more simple in my opinion.

"Maybe you could also do this with leads?"

I don't think leads make sense in this case, as they generally don't guarantee tight connections between entities, while stickiness would.

Also I think leads has more of an association with lifestock, whereas slime is more associated with the technical area of the game, such as redstone.
Great idea and this will also create potential for the powered minecart to be used again

This would be an great idea, but I feel as if your "train" should go slower based upon how many powered carts are moving vs how many empowered carts are perhaps 1 average Minecart with player could pull 10 other carts so you would need more people in the chain or furnace carts with coal or powered rails to pull more.
I like the idea, but maybe the sticky aspect might not be an option. Carriages / minecarts are by nature supposed to be connected to each other. This is just something missing in my opinion.

This is definitely missing.  The wheel is one of the oldest inventions to mankind.  

What could we do with wheels?

Carts - attach to horses for railless travel with multiple chests

Pulleys - a wheel can be an ingredient in pulleys.  Attach a chest to a pulley to hoist up when mining deep.

Boats - a wheel could be used when crafting larger boats (which Minecraft is considering)

Anyone else have a use for a wheel (that does not include engines)?

Crafting - a wheel can be made of wood, stone or iron (maybe even netherite).  Attach with a second to a stick or iron to make an axle which could be used for a cart.

The wheel could also be used to create a covered wagon - think of a boat on wheels that is covered so you can have a bed and a chest for exploring.  It'd also be a good way to tether a horse and not have it wander.
A wheel should provide a good foundation for gears as well, along with rollers, belts, and the lathe.

I think this a great idea. Could be used for carts which could be ridden like a boat when attached to a horse, donkey, or mule like a saddle, or you could place chests in them like a donkey. A good way to craft it might be 8 sticks around 1 plank in a crafting table. Could be used for other things too like a wagon, or covered wagon which would make traveling and exploring much much easier. I would make the cart a bit bigger than the boat, and the wagon 2x6. I would also make the option for the wagon to hook it up to several horses for faster travel.

Here's some of my ideas in how to make the wheel work. -
Any block or item that is placed on the wheel (maybe just the sides. U could probably use 2 fences on the side of wheel and attach the ride on the fence) stays on until u remove it. That would include wheels allowing wheels to connect as one big wheel. Have the wheel to be able to go up or down one block. And have a arrow on the wheel that is pointing in the direction that the wheel is going. Activating the wheel will make it and everything that is attached to it (or maybe only the ones that r attached on the sides of the wheel) move in the activated wheel's direction. Wheel can move on water but it will move VERY slowly. Wheel cannot go over fences. Wheel can be pushed or pulled (pulled by lead that's attached to fence on wheel) also.

If we're gonna do this, adding glue to keep blocks together maybe necessary! The wheel could be its own update theme cause I mean some other stuff like glue is needed!
